RS di Texas 'Live Streaming' Operasi Otak di Facebook
01 Nov 2019, 05:05 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Seorang wanita muda di Texas menjalani operasi otak dan disiarkan secara langsung di facebook (Istockphoto/gorodenkoff)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Seorang wanita muda di Texas menjalani operasi otak. Hanya saja ini bukan operasi biasa karena operasi otak ini dilakukan secara 'terbuka' dan ditayangkan langsung di Facebook. Rabu lalu, hampir 100 ribu orang menyaksikan satu massa otak Jenna Schardt dalam video 40 menit yang disiarkan Selasa pagi. Dalam video tersebut pasien berusia 25 tahun ini terlihat berbincang dengan dokter di salah satu sisi tirai operasi, sementara dokter bedah mengerjakan otaknya di sisi lainnya. Mengutip AFP, Schardt mengalami stroke karena adanya massa pembuluh darah di lobus temporal kiri. Kepala neurologi Methoidst Dallas Medical Center Nimesh Patel mengatakan bahwa hal ini memengaruhi kemampuannya untuk bicara. Dia tetap sadar ketika tengkoraknya dibuka. Tujuannya agar dokter bisa memastikan kalau mereka tak merusak bagian otak yang mengontrol kemampuan bicara ketika mereka bekerja. Mereka memintanya untuk mengucapkan kata-kata seperti burung, anjing, atau nomor, untuk memetakan 'otak.' "Agar kami dapat mengidentifikasi cara mendekati dan menghilangkan massa ini, kami harus menentukan area yang aman," kata Patel. Dokter bahkan bertanya pada Schardt tetang anjingnya untuk menguji ingatan dia selama empat setengah jam operasi. "Operasi otak dilakukan dengan sadar, meskipun dalam repertoar kami, itu tidak rutin," katanya. "Itu semua tergantung di mana lesi itu berada dan apakah pasien ingin sadar atau tidur."Schardt yang belajar tentang terapi okupasi, kata Patel, ingin memakai pengalaman itu untuk 'mendidik' penontonnya lewat siaran langsung di Facebook. (chs)

RS in Texas 'Live Streaming' Brain Operations on Facebook
01 Nov 2019, 05:05 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


A young woman in Texas has brain surgery and is broadcast live on Facebook (Istockphoto / gorodenkoff)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - A young woman in Texas undergoing brain surgery. It's just that this is not an ordinary operation because brain surgery is carried out 'openly' and broadcast live on Facebook. Last Wednesday, nearly 100,000 people watched a brain mass of Jenna Schardt in a 40-minute video broadcast Tuesday morning. In the video the 25-year-old patient is seen talking to a doctor on one side of the operating curtain, while the surgeon is working on his brain on the other side. Quoting AFP, Schardt suffered a stroke because of the mass of blood vessels in the left temporal lobe. The head of neurology at Methoidst Dallas Medical Center Nimesh Patel said that this affected his ability to speak. He remained conscious when his skull was opened. The goal is that doctors can ensure that they do not damage the part of the brain that controls speech when they are working. They asked him to say words such as birds, dogs, or numbers, to map out 'the brain.' "In order for us to identify ways to approach and eliminate this mass, we must determine a safe area," Patel said. The doctor even asked Schardt about his dog to test his memory for four and a half hours of surgery. "Brain surgery is done consciously, although in our repertoire, it is not routine," he said. "It all depends on where the lesion is located and whether the patient wants to wake up or sleep." Schardt, who is learning about occupational therapy, said Patel, wants to use that experience to 'educate' his audience through live broadcasts on Facebook. (chs)
